item.title: My weekly report, 16th February
item.description:
This is my weekly report of the rubbish arthritis fly tipped at the side of Harmony Way This is continuous and never-ending and Bromley Council do absolutely nothing to deter it other than come and clean up after these filthy people who think it’s okay just to chop rubbish on the floor

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic light pole damaged, 16th February
item.description:
The traffic signal post have been damaged and it’s leaning towards the floor , location is outside Sainsbury’s on charter house street

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Farringdon Street, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Damage - pole leaning / equipment detached from pole/facing the wrong direction

item.title: Whole of Imperial Way, 16th February
item.description:
Imperial Way road is in need of improvement, the road has been neglected, if you drive along it, it has constant dipped bumps in the road from wear. Very few improvements have been made, the road has buses every ten mins both ways and these buses shake the houses and cause our house to creak. Of a night this is frustrating because the buses tend to speed at night, making the issue worse. Can you consider improving the road condition?How is it fair that this nuisance is ignored by LBB. If it were the road you lived in, would you like to put up with it?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Gravelwood Close, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Garden cuttings dumped again!, 16th February
item.description:
This is an ongoing issue. Garden waste has been dumped at the Tweedy Road side of the old civic centre multi storey car park. As usual it’s where the electric car charging stations are (but on the Tweedy Road side of the wall). Please can’t be cleared away. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stockwell Close, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter dumped in alleyway, 16th February
item.description:
Please can the litter be removed from the alleyway. The alley way is footpath no.114. It runs behind the low numbers of Harwood Avenue between St Blaise Avenue/Rochester to Tweedy Road. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stockwell Close, Plaistow, Greater London

item.title: Rubbish, 16th February
item.description:
There is a huge amount of rubbish under the flyover which runs along the side of Manorside Close. Loads of bottles, some which look like they have urine in, cans, wood and general rubbish which doesn't look like it's been cleared in a very long time. Does not create a very good impression to visitors to the campsite or ruins when walking from the Elizabeth line via Florence Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Knee Hill, Abbey Wood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Holly tree over the pavement, 16th February
item.description:
This Holly tree is over the pavement path on 54 Sydney road. No push chair can go through when a van or even a car is parked in front. This is a way for many children to go to school in Sydney road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sydney Road, Blendon, Greater London
